messages.message: It’s very important that we either 1) rotate the image in Review OCR to reflect the transformation that occurred, or 2) map the coordinates back to the original orientation. Anyone have an idea of what kind of effort this would be?
@Jonathan Shih would know this one best. I believe he knows the rotation code, and would have to depend on @Heymian and @Aaron Tami as they know the state of the refactored Process File step

It would prob be best to rotate the image in review ocr so people aren't looking at it upside down. Not sure how much effort it would be, but we have the angle and the translation, so we should just be able to do an image transformation on it.

It would be a matter of updating Process Files to make sure we write the correct processed_image_path content, then followed by making sure that Review OCR loads that image (the 2nd part should be done I think)
I see, can someone assist in this? This is actually high priority for a demo on Thursday next week
Here is the relevant Asana task: https://app.asana.com/0/709988732359958/1128113216111008/f
if no one else can help, i can work on this. not sure if i’ll be able to start on it until monday though
